decision_conditions: The Oak tree is situated within the Rear garden of 36 Park Avenue and can be seen from the public highway within Sherwood Avenue. Along with other nearby trees it helps to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings Broadwood Avenue/ Park Avenue and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The Oak has a high amenity value and significantly contributes to the arboricultural character of the local area.

The Oak appears to have a healthy natural canopy typical of this species. There is evidence of minor past pruning of lower limbs over the garage but no significant work has previously been carried out. The applicant wishes to carry out work due to concerns for future damage to the neighbours property and further damage to the garage however no evidence of this damage has been included and no evidence linking damage to the tree. Pruning by 20% would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into its crown, which would likely cause stress and lead t
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 20% to One Oak T16 on TPO 294
